title: Holiday Money Diaries: What I spent on a budget solo holiday in Dubai
text:
Welcome to the ninth instalment of Holiday Money Diaries, a series in which travellers reveal every penny they spent while away. This week: a four-day solo trip to Dubai. The total spent is at the bottom.

It has been a horrible year, fraught with family illness, heartbreak and bereavement – and as winter’s grip fastened, I was desperate for escape. Maybe I was running away, but I set my sights on a minibreak in the sunniest and most optimistic place I could think of: Dubai.

I lived there for two years, and whenever I return to the UAE it puts a spring in my step. The city can be hideously expensive, of course, but this wasn’t your typical Dubai blow-out – I’ve seen the big hitters (Burj Khalifa, Dubai Mall, Downtown) more times than I care to remember. I was travelling on my own, but decided to stay at the cheaper end of town.
